column5: Hey all,  Jim Jigger and I decided to try a new to us lake, near North Bay on Sunday. From what I know, this lake holds BIG walleye. The plan was simple... find access to the lake, walk out and drill a billion holes until we find structure or fish. Turns out the plans was a  bit of bust since we found nothing but 12feet of water. All we got were a few perch, one near 10inches.  3:00 arrives and my dad calls "you wanna snowmobile to the shack?" Since I opted out of driving to shack due to potentially bad ice conditions, and this "new" lake was a bust...I packed everything and headed to the landing on Nipissing. From the moment we dropped the lines, the perch were furious. Within an hour the walleye moved in. I caught three keepers, let go one tiny cigar, let go one in the slot and missed a BIG MOTHA at the hole. In total I have 25 perch to clean and three Walleye...pretty good for 2 hours of fishing.... the ice shack never fails.        Enjoy,  RC
WTG RC! Gunna make a serious feed there.
Sounds like a nice, adventurous day, and you got supper too  Great report.
Nice job RC Your last minute decision sure paid off Keep up the excellent work!!! Leechman
Nice haul i should have went to nip with ya oh well we'have tales to tell tomorrow.
Nice report and nice fish.  Can't wait to get out there, only been twice this winter.
Now that looked like a worthwhile day!!! You never know what a lake has to offer if you don't give it a shot!
Nice fish they look like good eating Great report
Thanks all!  Here's the next step. Egg and lemon pepper batter ...following step will...follow
Chad.... do you deliver up in Qu√©bec? Looks delish
Sorry...no next step. I was too hungry and ate it.
LOL Chad.... I'm sure it tastes great    No worries
Good on ya.  Fished Nip twice this weekend with only a herring and a small handful of perch to show for it. you've got the walters dialed in
nice going looks like a good meal
